content.rendered:
Privacy Policy 

 

This page explains our policies for the disclosure, collection, and use of personal information when you use our Service, as well as your options for handling such information.

Your information is used to improve and provide better service. By using our Dexit services, you agree to this data collection and use policy. Unless otherwise stated in this Policy, words have the same meaning as in our Terms and Conditions, which can be found at Dexit Network.

Data Collection and Usage

We collect several information to offer you and improve our Service. Personal data is one of the types of information collected.

We may ask you to provide us with personal information that can be used to identify or contact you (\”Personal Information\”) when you use our Service. The types of personal information that can be collected include:

Your first and last name

Usage data and cookies

Phone number/email address

Address, city, state, zip-code province

We may contact you through newsletters, advertising or marketing materials, and other information that may be of interest to you using your Personal Data. You may unsubscribe from any or all of these communications from us by clicking the unsubscribe link or by following the instructions in the contact us section or by any email we send you. Third-party data processors will store photos and identification data in order to comply with anti-money laundering laws.

Usage Data

We may also collect data about how our service is used and accessed (\”Usage Data\”). This usage data may include the following information:

Your computer’s Internet Protocol address (for example, IP address).

Pages of our services you visited.

The time spent on those pages.

Browser type.

Time and date of your visit.

Browser version.

Diagnostic data.

Other unique device identifiers.

Tracking Cookies Data

We use tracking technologies and similar cookies to track activities on our Service and store specific data.

Cookies are small data files that may or may not contain suspicious or unique identifiers. Cookies are small text files that a website sends to your browser and stores on your device. Scripts, Beacons, and tags are examples of tracking technologies used to collect and track data and design and evaluate our Service.

You can set your browser to reject all cookies or notify you when they have been received. You may not be able to use some parts of our Service if you refuse to accept cookies.

We use the following types of cookies:

Security Cookies. For security reasons, we use security cookies.

Cookies that are only used during a session. For our Service to work, we need session cookies.

Cookies that remember your preferences. Preference cookies are used to remember your preferences and other settings.

Retention of Data

We will only store your Personal Data for as long as it is necessary to achieve the goals set out in this term and conditions policy. We will retain and use your Personal Data to the extent necessary to comply with our legal obligations (for instance, if applicable laws force us to resolve disputes, retain your data) and enforce our legal policies and agreements.

Dexit also stores usage data for internal research and analysis. Unless this data is used to enhance security or improve the performance of our Service, or we are legally obligated to retain this data for extended periods of time, we will use the data for a shorter period of time.

Transfer of Data

Your data, including Personal Information, may be transferred to and stored on computers outside your state, province, country, or another state territory where data protection rules may differ from those in your jurisdiction.

Your permission to do so is reflected in your acceptance of this Privacy Policy and your submission of such information.

Dexit will take all reasonable steps to ensure that your data is treated securely according to this Privacy Policy. Your Personal Data will not be transferred to an organization or company unless appropriate controls are in place, including the security of your data and other personal details are in place.

Disclosure of Information by Law Enforcement Agencies

If required by law or in response to legal requirements of government agencies, Dexit may be forced to disclose your Personal Information (for example, in a court or government agency).

Legal Requirements

Dexit may disclose your Personal Information if we have reason to believe it is necessary to:

To protect against legal consequences

To protect the rights and property of Dexit

To prevent or investigate potential inappropriate behavior in connection with the Service

to comply with the requirements of the law

Data protection

To protect the personal safety of users of the Service and the general public.

We care about the security of your information but remember that no method of data transmission over the Internet or storage on a computer is completely secure. While we make every effort to protect your Personal Information using commercially reasonable methods, we cannot guarantee its complete security.

Do Not Track (DNT) is not something we support. Do not track is a browser setting that lets websites know that you do not want to be tracked. By going to your browser’s settings or settings page, you can enable or disable the Do Not Track feature—the ability to revoke permission. You also have the option to revoke your consent to the processing of your personal data by Dexit at any time.

Links to other sites

Our Service may contain links to third-party websites that are not under our control. You will be redirected to a third-party website if you click on a third-party link. Every site you visit should have a Privacy Policy that you should read. We do not control third-party sites or services’ content, privacy policies, or actions, and we are not responsible for them.

Analytics

Third-party service providers may be used to monitor and evaluate the use of our Service.

Children’s Privacy

Our Service does not serve children under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from children under the age of 18. Contact us if you are a parent or guardian, and you know that your child has provided Personal Information to us. If we find that we have received Personal Data from children without parental permission, we will take steps to remove the data from our servers.

Changes to this Privacy Statement

We may make changes to our Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be communicated to you by posting an updated Privacy Policy on this page.

Before the change becomes effective, we will notify you via email and/or public notice of our Service, and we will change the \”effective date\” at the top of this Privacy Policy. It is recommended that you regularly check this Privacy Policy for updates. When changes to the latest Privacy Policy are posted on this page, they become effective.

Don’t hesitate to get in touch with us if you have any questions regarding our Privacy Policy.
